    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    deleteUser()
    This function allows the user to delete a registered user from the system.
    static void
    main(String[] args)
    The main function creates an instance of the Executable class and calls its menu method.
    void
    menu()
    This function displays a menu with options for managing users, products, and uses, and allows the user to select an option or exit the menu.
    void
    menuProduct()
    This function displays a menu with options to register a product, show all product information, or modify a product.
    void
    menuReports()
    This function displays a menu of options for generating reports on the total pages read, most read genre and category, book sales, and subscription sales.
    void
    menuUsers()
    This function displays a menu for managing user information and performs the selected action based on user input.
    void
    menuUses()
    This function displays a menu with options to sell a product, read a product, or view reports and executes the corresponding function based on the user's choice.
    void
    modifyProduct()
    This function allows the user to modify a product in the system by selecting the product and choosing which category to change and what to change it to.
    void
    modifyUser()
    This function allows the user to modify an existing user's name, nickname, or category in a system.
    void
    mostReadGenreAndCategory()
    This function prints the most read genre and category in a system.
    void
    readingProduct(int userOption, String choiceID)
    This function allows the user to read a product, navigate through its pages, and return to the library or main menu.
    void
    readProduct()
    This function reads a product from a product library based on user input.
    void
    registerProduct()
    This function registers a new product (either a book or a magazine) by prompting the user for information and calling the appropriate method in the rXSystem object.
    void
    registerUser()
    This Java function registers a new user by prompting the user to input their personal information and type of user, and then calls a method to register the user in a system.
    void
    sellingsByCategory()
    This function prints out the sales by category in a retail system.
    void
    sellingsByGenre()
    This function prints the sales data by genre in a Java program.
    void
    sellProduct()
    This function allows the user to sell a product by selecting it from a list and choosing a user to sell it to.
    void
    showAllProductInfo()
    This Java function displays all the product information registered in the system.
    void
    showAllUserInfo()
    This function displays all the user information registered in the system.
    void
    showUserInfo()
    This function displays a list of registered users in the system and allows the user to select a user to view their information.
    void
    totalReadPages()
    This Java function prints the total number of read pages using the rXSystem object.

    • menu

      public void menu()
      This function displays a menu with options for managing users, products, and uses, and allows the user to select an option or exit the menu.

    • menuUses

      public void menuUses()
      This function displays a menu with options to sell a product, read a product, or view reports and executes the corresponding function based on the user's choice.

    • menuReports

      public void menuReports()
      This function displays a menu of options for generating reports on the total pages read, most read genre and category, book sales, and subscription sales.

    • menuProduct

      public void menuProduct()
      This function displays a menu with options to register a product, show all product information, or modify a product.

    • menuUsers

      public void menuUsers()
      This function displays a menu for managing user information and performs the selected action based on user input.

    • registerUser

      public void registerUser()
      This Java function registers a new user by prompting the user to input their personal information and type of user, and then calls a method to register the user in a system.

    • modifyUser

      public void modifyUser()
      This function allows the user to modify an existing user's name, nickname, or category in a system.

    • deleteUser

      public void deleteUser()
      This function allows the user to delete a registered user from the system.

    • showUserInfo

      public void showUserInfo()
      This function displays a list of registered users in the system and allows the user to select a user to view their information.

    • showAllUserInfo

      public void showAllUserInfo()
      This function displays all the user information registered in the system.

    • registerProduct

      public void registerProduct()
      This function registers a new product (either a book or a magazine) by prompting the user for information and calling the appropriate method in the rXSystem object.

    • modifyProduct

      public void modifyProduct()
      This function allows the user to modify a product in the system by selecting the product and choosing which category to change and what to change it to.

    • sellProduct

      public void sellProduct()
      This function allows the user to sell a product by selecting it from a list and choosing a user to sell it to.

    • showAllProductInfo

      public void showAllProductInfo()
      This Java function displays all the product information registered in the system.

    • readProduct

      public void readProduct()
      This function reads a product from a product library based on user input.

    • readingProduct

      public void readingProduct(int userOption, String choiceID)
      This function allows the user to read a product, navigate through its pages, and return to the library or main menu.
      Parameters:
      userOption - The user's selected option for reading a product, such as reading a book or a magazine. It could be an integer value representing the option chosen from a menu.
      choiceID - The ID of the product that the user wants to read.

    • sellingsByCategory

      public void sellingsByCategory()
      This function prints out the sales by category in a retail system.

    • sellingsByGenre

      public void sellingsByGenre()
      This function prints the sales data by genre in a Java program.

    • mostReadGenreAndCategory

      public void mostReadGenreAndCategory()
      This function prints the most read genre and category in a system.

    • totalReadPages

      public void totalReadPages()
      This Java function prints the total number of read pages using the rXSystem object.
